meanings.definition: To apply pressure and friction to a surface with a repeated back-and-forth motion.
meanings.sent1: She rubbed the eraser on the paper to remove the pencil marks.
meanings.sent2: The cat rubbed against my leg to show affection.
meanings.sent3: He rubbed the lamp vigorously, hoping a genie would appear.
meanings.sent4: The old man rubbed his hands together, trying to generate warmth.
meanings.sent5: The athlete rubbed his sore muscles after a long workout.

meanings.definition: To move one's hand or an object back and forth against a surface.
meanings.sent1: Mom rubbed the cloth on the table to clean up the spill.
meanings.sent2: The boy rubbed the stick against the stone to start a fire.
meanings.sent3: She rubbed the magic lamp and out came a mischievous genie.
meanings.sent4: The DJ rubbed the vinyl record, preparing to play the next song.
meanings.sent5: The artist rubbed the charcoal on the paper to create shadows.

meanings.definition: To cause irritation or discomfort by rubbing.
meanings.sent1: The new shoes rubbed against her heels, causing blisters.
meanings.sent2: The tag on his shirt rubbed against his neck, making him itchy.
meanings.sent3: The prankster rubbed the balloon on his hair to create static electricity.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise rubbed on her nerves, making her anxious.
meanings.sent5: The rough fabric rubbed against his skin, making it red and sore.
